channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10366] 0.94 filterRow() may be skipped in 0.96(or onwards) code
item.description:
HBASE-6429 combines both filterRow & filterRow(List<KeyValue> kvs) functions in Filter.
While 0.94 code or older, it may not implement hasFilterRow as HBase-6429 expected because 0.94(old) hasFilterRow only returns true when filterRow(List<KeyValue> kvs) is overridden not the filterRow(). Therefore, the filterRow() will be skipped.

Since we don't ask 0.94 users to update their existing filter code, the issue will cause scan returns unexpected keyvalues and break the backward compatibility.
item.summary: 0.94 filterRow() may be skipped in 0.96(or onwards) code

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12623509/hbase-10366.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12623509

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop1.1. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.1 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8449//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8449//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop2-compat.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8449//console

This message is automatically generated.
Is this for Hive Jeffrey Zhong?
Never mind, I see the Phoenix tag. Same difference.
Is there a unit test that covers the old method and behavior we put back here?
I manually verified in Phoenix on 0.96. Let me try to add a filter test case to cover this change. Thanks.
Thanks, +1 for trunk and 0.98 with a unit test. Edit: Actually without one too, but thanks in advance for one.

The javadoc in Filter.java should be revised:


   * @return True if this filter actively uses filterRow(List) or filterRow().

   */

  abstract public boolean hasFilterRow();

Thanks All for the reviews! v1 patch adds a unit test.

Ted Yu The Javadoc for current hasFilterRow() is all right because new filter implementation should follow that way in the future. I modified some comments in my previous patch to specifically call out that 0.94 hasFilterRow() has different semantics.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12623732/hbase-10366-v1.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12623732

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop1.1. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.1 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Thanks for the reviews! I've integrated the v1 patch into trunk, 0.98 & 0.96 branches.
